introduction: In this video, the speaker shares their experience of struggling to find a job in software engineering despite having high expectations for salary and work culture. They discuss how they had to quickly learn data structures and algorithms to pass coding interviews at big tech companies like Google and Meta. The video covers the strategies and resources used to master these concepts and pass the interviews in just four weeks.

sections.title: Section 1: The Problem
content: Realized that the company I got my software engineering job from was not a good fit for me.
Faced high expectations for salary and work culture.
Had to find a new job in four weeks.
Discovered that I was not properly prepared for coding interviews.

sections.title: Section 2: Understanding Data Structures and Algorithms
content: Learned that to pass even Google-level interviews, you only need to know how to pass medium-level coding interviews.
Discovered a famous blind 75 lead code problems list as a benchmark for coding interviews.
Used a course on Coursera and Algo Monster to understand building blocks and principles.
Applied conceptual understanding into code.

sections.title: Section 3: Applying Conceptual Understanding into Code
content: Solved problems conceptually and then applied that understanding into code.
Started with simple problems and gradually moved to more complex ones.
Used the golden resource of the blind 75 lead code problems list to master problems.
Practiced and applied concepts in a systematic way.

sections.title: Section 4: Mastering Data Structures and Algorithms
content: Mastered data structures and algorithms in just four weeks.
Used a step-by-step plan to study problems systematically.
Focused on understanding the concepts and their applications.
Applied concepts into code and solved problems.

sections.title: Section 5: Passing the Interview and Moving Forward
content: Passed the interview and was ecstatic.
Decided not to take the job and instead moved to Dubai to focus on YouTube and building a starter full-time business.
Realized the importance of confidence and self-belief in pursuing entrepreneurial dreams.
Applied the skills learned to pass coding interviews to other areas of life.
